Review:
completion:
Elden Ring was the first soulslike game I ever completed 100% — all achievements, every boss, every corner of the map explored. No other game has ever pulled me in the way Elden Ring did: I kept telling myself “just one more area, just one more boss,” and suddenly dozens of hours had disappeared. The world, the lore, the music, and that feeling of overcoming impossible fights made it feel less like a game and more like a long, epic journey.

Now it feels like Miyazaki has “hooked” me into trying to finish every Souls game at 100%, because nothing else gives the same mix of challenge and satisfaction. Elden Ring didn’t just become one of my favorite games — it set a new standard for what I expect from action RPGs.
Nihil Nihil Nihil

Review:
completion:
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐ A Masterpiece in Every Sense — Elden Ring Sets a New Standard

Elden Ring isn’t just a game. It’s an experience that sticks with you long after you turn it off. From the moment you step into the Lands Between, you realize you’re playing something truly special. The world is massive, mysterious, beautiful, and terrifying all at once — and none of it feels empty. Every corner hides a secret, every horizon pulls you in, and every enemy demands respect.

The combat is brutal but fair, and the boss fights are some of the most unforgettable encounters I’ve ever had in any game. The sense of achievement after overcoming a tough challenge is unmatched. The game never holds your hand, but it constantly rewards curiosity, patience, and skill.

The atmosphere, music, lore, characters… everything comes together perfectly. It’s dark, epic, emotional, and full of moments that feel legendary. I genuinely felt like I was carving my own story.

Elden Ring isn’t just my favorite FromSoftware game — it’s one of the greatest games ever made. If you’re hesitating, don’t. Just dive in and let the world consume you.

10/10 — A modern classic.

-2016 updated skill tree options
-Good graphics

-limited teleportation system
-Unbalanced nerfs and buffs
-Harsh penalties that result into crating more bitter players
-LIMITED REPORTING SYSTEM
-Ping delays, 25% of the time.
-Abilities can be glitched out to bypass certain rules
-Commendation obsession of the community.
-Spamming messages have no warning prompts.

completion: Elden Ring stands out as one of the best games ever because it masterfully blends open-world exploration, deep lore, and challenging but rewarding gameplay into an experience that feels truly epic. Its world is massive and beautifully designed, filled with secrets, atmospheric locations, and unforgettable bosses that make every discovery feel earned. The freedom to approach challenges in your own way—whether through combat, magic, stealth, or creative builds—gives players a sense of agency rarely matched in modern games. Combined with stunning art direction, a haunting soundtrack, and storytelling that invites curiosity instead of hand-holding, Elden Ring creates an immersive adventure that sticks with players long after they finish it, cementing its place as a masterpiece in gaming.

Early game is fun but I'm just not into the world or exploring. I have played a lot of open world games and loved them especially with mods but this is just too open and aimless for a fromsoft game. Dark souls 1 is one of the best games I ever played, I also really enjoyed 2 and think it's a good game with some flaws but this, which neither 1 or 2 suffered from, is boring. Sad to say it, I want to like this game but It's just really dull.

 I wanted to buy DS3 but it wasnt on sale so I bought this instead since everyone rates it so highly. Honestly very very very average experience, I think if you have not played many open world games/RPGs or fromsofts previous titles you'll probably like this but just know this game is not a masterpiece and the people saying that are genuinely clueless as in they have not touched a good RPG in their life hence they see this as "10/10." Dark souls 1 was a masterpiece on it's own for what it did, this is absolutely mediocre and I hate to say it since I paid 50 CAD for it and I literally don't wanna continue it. Hopefully 3 goes on sale and they stop asking retail price for a 10 year old game

Review:
completion:
Cyberpunk 2077 is finally in a great place. On v2.3x, performance was smooth and stable throughout.

Gunplay, movement, and customization feel great, and Night City looks incredible—especially with path tracing. The characters are memorable and player choices actually matter.

The main story is a bit short, side “Gig” missions can feel repetitive, and progression caps too early, but these issues don’t outweigh the experience.

Overall, a very strong and immersive game that I absolutely recommend.

Write a review for the game "ELDEN RING".

Constraints:
- Length: 100 to 140 words

- Output only the review text

Review:
completion:
The first part of the game until you get past the capital is incredible. The game stumbles a bit after, with over-tuned and overused enemies. You can clearly tell fromsoft put a lot of time and effort into the game leading up to the capital, and the rest afterwards was a bit more rushed and less methodical. 
The late-game one-shot potential of ordinary enemies, especially ones that are reused is my main critique. For me at least, I just end up avoiding a lot of fights in the late game vs feeling a meaningful and enjoyable increase in difficulty. The late game bosses are a bit over-tuned I felt as well, with some feeling like sekiro enemies, while you are stuck with ER mechanics. 
On another note, the game is in dire need of a quest log or something of the sort. Trying to navigate some storylines is near impossible without a guide. You should just have the ER wiki ready to go when you load up the game and accept using it. 

Overall, 9/10. The game is utterly beautiful and chopped full of content, but definitely has its weak points.

For someone new to Souls-like games.
BEWARE : You are in for a regretful journey for hours.
Then it clicks.... You're supposed to die.
This game is EXTREMELY difficult, all enemies can not be taken lightly and all boss fights are different, you will die learning their patterns just don't play this game without turning your brain on and investing knowledge into how the enemies move, react and when the best time to strike them is.
The game itself is very good, you defeat bosses and feel like you've solved the solution to world hunger. 
But be patient, if you're having an off day, turn it off and come back tomorrow.

Review:
completion:
Having played through the entire game several times on different platforms, I recommend it highly for its luxurious cyberpunk feel. The storylines are engaging, there are easter eggs in abundance, and there is plenty of content to keep you amused for a long time. 

I'm in two minds about the changes to the progression systems - I preferred the earlier version, and can't see why the devs nerfed the modding system for clothing and weapons, which was a bit weird, but seemed to work well.

The game did suffer a lot from early release bugs and issues but these have mostly been ironed out and new features added. This game could really do with a coop version to engage a broader player base and re-engage people like me who now need an excuse to go back to it, but it provided a lot of interesting and enjoyable game play over the years.

9/10 for look, feel, humor, characterizations and a decent story to follow, and, of course, Keanu Reeves... but you do need a pretty fast system and excellent graphics card to really make the most of it - it runs like a dog on low end systems...

completion: This game had amazing potential. It's still pretty good, but it has a couple of things that thoroughly annoy me to my core. First and foremost is that there is never a quiet room in this entire city! There are tv's in every single space of the entire world in this game. The other thing is the fact that you spend the entire game hacking wall sockets to upload deamons that are just far too common and get boring after the second time you do it..... so enjoy the next 4,500 times you do it.. There is a possibility that there is a perk that makes them automatic or skip the actual hacking sequence.... not sure, but it wasn't the skill tree I built, which is making for a miserable experience after 250 hours. Write a review for the game "Cyberpunk 2077".

Constraints:
- Length: 100 to 140 words
- Mention exactly 2 positive points and 1 negative point
- Casual, honest tone

- Output only the review text

Review:
completion:
Cyberpunk 2077 is the only game where you buy a $3,000 cybernetic eye just to still miss every shot, crash your car into a vending machine, and get emotionally manipulated by an NPC who looks better than you ever will.

Night City is alive. Too alive. Every pedestrian has a full backstory, a trauma, and a reason to walk directly into your car at 200 km/h.

The graphics? Insane. My GPU aged 5 years in 10 minutes. Ray tracing so realistic I could see my own bad life decisions reflected in puddles.

The story hits hard. One minute you’re saving the city, the next you’re questioning free will, capitalism, and why Keanu Reeves lives rent-free in your brain telling you to commit crimes.

Bugs? Sure. Sometimes NPCs T-pose to assert dominance. Cars spawn inside other cars. But honestly… that just makes it more cyberpunk.

Cyberpunk 2077 isn’t just a game.
It’s a beautiful, glitchy, existential crisis simulator where style matters more than morals and everyone needs therapy.

9/10. Would install illegal chrome again.

Review:
completion:
The word on the street is that the longer you play it the more you will like it. But the more I played this extremely scripted, limited, tedious virtual novel wearing the skin mask of a half-baked Far Cry beta, the more I disliked it. Jack of no trades and master of none. Even at 20 dollars this was too much. People say (rightly) that Ghostwire Tokyo and Starfield are half baked mediocrities, and to a certain extent they are right, but I would happily play them for hours compared to spending one more hour in this tedium simulator. The first does urban exploration better, the second at least lets me explore its bleak dead world without having to be pestered by a phone, endless cutscenes, and nonstop mostly linear dialogue as its core focus. 

If 'Press E to advance conversation' was a game.

completion:
Counter-Strike 2 is not just the best shooter right now — it will always be the best shooter. The game keeps everything that made Counter-Strike legendary: skill-based gunplay, intense competitive matches, and the need for real teamwork.

The Source 2 engine makes the game smoother and cleaner without changing its core identity. Every round feels important, and improvement actually matters. That’s why CS2 stands above other shooters.

I’m also waiting for the return of operations, which will make the game even more enjoyable with new missions and content. CS2 isn’t just a game — it’s a classic that will never die.

Elden ring is definitely one of the best gaming experiences i ever had. 
This game kind of has it all. It is as hard / easy as you make it. Challenges you without being unfair. It has endless build varieties, and therefore huge replay value IMO. It looks absolutely stunning and the gameplay is smooth and fantastic.

The lore and story is where it is really at though, at least for me (Huge shoutout to Smoughtown, tarnished archeologist, honored madman, the alchemist, and all the other superb creators on Youtube). 
This well thought out world adds a ton of weight to the gameplay and transforms this game from pure entertainment to a one of a kind experience that far surpasses previous From Software games in scale and depth.

It feels like everything that can be said about Cyberpunk 2077 has already been said - but in a way, that’s exactly the point. The fact that people are still talking about it 5 years later is proof that it has earned its place as a modern classic.

Despite its rocky launch, occasional writing inconsistencies, and a main story that can at times feel more linear than expected for an RPG, the care the development team has put into the game and the addition of Phantom Liberty has helped solidify the game as a genuinely great experience, offering fun and flexible gameplay, a wide range of viable builds, a gripping narrative, memorable characters you grow attached to, and an outstanding voice acting cast that truly brings the world to life.

And this is without even addressing the game's world's level of immersion, or the strength of its art direction and visual presentation.

Review:
completion: this game has literally saved my life.. I was unfortunately one of many victims that was given drugs that had absolutely no place being in any drug, let alone a drug that was meant to be a large animal tranquilizer. I received 12 surgeries and possibly will have another soon, and have been bed ridden for over two years. This game allowed me to leave this horror of a life for as long as possible and still has such an amazing and positive impact on my life and I believe without this game giving me the level of absolute freedom to just explore, challenge myself and play MANY different playthroughs, I have over 700 hours on Steam, and 2,500+ hours via playstation and those numbers will always be climbing. Thank you Fromsoft and thank you to the community for unknowingly walking this road with me with a ton of support, tips, secrets, etc... I will always remember those moments.. I couldn't put into words how much these developers helped me escape and never come back, I will always support this company and community

completion: A very good game. After a rocky start, the devs rallied and got it into working order. Fun, dynamic world, with a lot of interesting premises and characters, the magic system is a little weird (selecting hacks from a list), but the game is more designed around the gunplay anyway. Even the procedural quests are pretty fun to play with (for the most part). Soundtrack is awesome, and the art style is pretty perfect for the game.

come look at this huge open world full of detail!!! but for the first 15 hours you HAVE to go exactly where we say and do exactly what we tell you to!!! there have been MULTIPLE TIMES that I haven't been able to sit in a chair until I'm told to. RPG my ass. this is embarassing.

the game is written like I should care about someone I met 5 minutes ago dying. I don't. I want to shoot guys and hack stuff and fly around like a maniac. cutthroat mercenaries aren't typically known for having """""deep""""" conversations with """""friends"""""
